statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

article.description:
Weary at the end of a long road trip, the New
Jersey Nets got a breather -- and didn't mind saying so.
article.headline: Howard ejected in Nuggets' fifth straight loss
article.linkText: Nets easily win 'practice' game against Nuggets
article.story:
DENVER (AP) -- Weary at the end of a long road trip, the New Jersey Nets got a breather -- and didn't mind saying so.
Kidd

"This game was more or less practice,'' guard Jason Kidd said after the Nets rolled over the turnover-prone Denver Nuggets 92-66 on Monday night. Added coach Byron Scott, "As much as you try to tell yourself that you have to play extra hard because this is a team that can sneak up and bite you if you're not ready, guys know. They know we have a better team than they do.'' Richard Jefferson scored 23 points and Kenyon Martin had 17 points and nine rebounds as the Nets handed the NBA's second-worst team its fifth straight loss. Lucious Harris added 16 points and seven rebounds for the Nets, who used a 20-4 run in the second quarter to take control. Scott admitted it was an "ugly game'' but said his team "did salvage the road trip after the way we started.'' After losing their first three games on the five-game trip, the Nets won the last two. Vincent Yarbrough had 13 points and was the lone double-digit scorer for Denver, which self-destructed in the second period with 15 turnovers and three quick technical fouls, two of which resulted in the ejection of leading scorer Juwan Howard. "The Nuggets have some athletes over there,'' Scott said, "and luckily for us Juwan got kicked out of the game. That pretty much took away their post-up presence.'' The Nets built a 41-26 halftime lead and extended their margin to 23 points early in the third quarter. Denver finished with a season-high 32 turnovers. The lowest-scoring team in the NBA, the Nuggets were held below 70 points for the fifth time this season. "We were very sluggish and very sloppy,'' coach Jeff Bzdelik said. "We didn't move on offense, we missed a lot of layups, we were selfish and we let our emotions get away from us. I'm extremely disappointed.'' Asked if there were any positives, Bzdelik said, "None.'' Asked if this was as bad as his team has played this season, he said, "I think so.'' Nets guard Kerry Kittles was not with the team, having flown home to New Jersey after Friday's game in Los Angeles to attend to a family matter. Martin and Harris each had six points in the first quarter as the Nets outshot Denver 57 percent to 37 percent and took a 21-16 lead. New Jersey pulled away in the second period, using the 20-4 flurry in the first 10 minutes to forge a 41-20 lead. Jefferson had five points early in the quarter, and Kidd hit three consecutive free throws following the three technicals against Denver, making it 31-18. Donnell Harvey drew the first technical after committing an offensive foul. Howard, already upset at drawing his third personal foul seconds earlier, jawed at referee Ken Mauer, then pursued him down the court while Bzdelik tried to restrain his player. With Howard gone, the Nuggets continued to founder. Martin scored seven of New Jersey's next 10 points, including a slam dunk on an alley-oop pass from Kidd. The Nuggets scored the last six points of the half, four by Rodney White, to cut the halftime deficit to 41-26. New Jersey shot only 26 percent in the quarter but capitalized on 15 Denver turnovers. Kidd hit a 3-pointer and Jefferson had a pair of three-point plays as the Nets went up 53-30 with 8:22 left in the third period. Denver countered with an 11-4 run to cut the deficit to 15 but could get no closer. Game notes
Before the game, the Nuggets activated guard Chris Whitney from the injured list and waived guard John Crotty. Whitney had been on the injured list since Dec. 20 with a bone bruise on his left ankle. ... Nets center Dikembe Mutombo, on the injured list since Jan. 3 with torn ligaments in his right wrist, will have the cast taken off Tuesday and has targeted March 15 for his return. ... Denver's Marcus Camby, who missed his fifth straight game because of a sprained right ankle, hopes to return Saturday at Dallas. ... The Nets won for just the fifth time in 30 games in Denver since the two teams joined the NBA in 1976. ... The Nuggets attempted just 56 shots, a record low for the franchise. The previous low was 61 at Seattle on Jan. 3. They made only 21 shots, tying a season low.
